The included analyzer comes with the simplified, preconfigured

majority of noise-complaint cases when accompanied by sound 
recordings of disturbances.  It has broadband logging of the 
equivalent continuous level (LAeq) at one second intervals without 
frequency and statistics to keep the measurement project small.

upgrade kit (MATRON 4 Type 3668-W) and install the free 
MATRON 4 firmware on your analyzer.
 Use the Included Analyzer as a Stand-alone Analyzer

analyzer, you will need additional hardware, such as a battery. 
 The suggested hardware for performing standard environmental 
QB-0061: Lithium-ion battery for hand-held analyzers 
KE-0441: Leather equipment cover for hand-held analyzers 
UA-1651: Tripod extension for hand-held analyzers 
UA-0237: Windscreen for 1/2 microphones

Which solution should I use if I want co.text:
MATRON 4 includes a 1 year licence for one analyzer for 
Measurement Partner Suite BZ-5503, the post-processing platform 
(PC software) for Brüel & Kjær Hand-held Analyzers and the 
systems built on them, covering all the post processing 
functionality you will need when working with measurement data.

metadata.window:
MATRON 4 is typically used for domestic noise assessments in the 
United Kingdom according to the Environmental Protection Act 
1990.  The system is installed in an indoor environment, such as a 
home or an office, and left to continuously log noise data for up to 
14 days.  During this period, the noise levels are measured and 
stored, and the complainant makes sound recordings of 
disturbances by simply pressing a button.
 MATRON 4 includes a 1 year licence for one analyzer for 
Measurement Partner Suite BZ-5503, the post-processing platform 
(PC software) for Brüel & Kjær Hand-held Analyzers and the 
systems built on them, covering all the post processing 
functionality you will need when working with measurement data. 
 Measurement Partner Suite also includes data storage in MP Cloud 
which can be useful when sharing data between offices.
 General indoor noise logging tasks 
Simple, preconfigured, ready-to-use MATRON 4 
2 Gb industrial quality SD card 
Power supply via mains (battery optional) 
Full analysis capability in Measurement Partner Suite
– Type 3668-L-SC: The complete kit
– Type 3668-L-S: The complete kit minus the sound calibrator
– Type 3668-W: The upgrade kit 
MATRON 4 is built around Brüel & Kjær® Hand-held Analyzer 
Type 2250-L.  The analyzer is supplied without a battery and 
installed in a lockable hard-shell case.

systems built on them, covering all the post processing 
functionality you will need when working with measurement data.

Which solution is better for a universit.text:
In some cases it is easier to set up the project in the office using the PC app, such as for surveys with a large number of
partitions to test.

metadata.window:
When you create a new project, the project settings of
the last open project are reused but the room and partition settings are cleared.  Project setup is then just a matter of
defining geometries and making small adjustments before you can start to measure.  The advantage of defining geo-
metries on site is that it allows you to select the best rooms to use based on the actual conditions of the site.
 In some cases it is easier to set up the project in the office using the PC app, such as for surveys with a large number of
partitions to test.  To transfer the project setup to the mobile app, you will upload what is called the project definition to
the instrument.  A project definition is a copy of a project settings minus any measurement data, if it exists.  When you
connect the mobile app to the instrument, you will be able to work with the project you created on the PC app.
metadata.original_text:
In some cases it is easier to set up the project in the office using the PC app, such as for surveys with a large number of
partitions to test.

I need a solution that complies with noi.text: This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

metadata.window:
Accurate noise measurement, analysis and reporting has never been more simple.

 This sound level meter platform houses the solution that gets your job done faster and easier.  Controlled via smart-device apps tailored to your task, get your work done with confidence.

 This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

 This SLM-based survey solution simplifies your job of ensuring standards compliance and employee safety, including the data for selecting hearing protection.

 This sound level meter-based product noise measurement solution combines ease of use with reliable, valid data.  Controlled via smart-device apps tailored to your product noise measurement task, B&K 2245 with Product Noise Partner gets the job done.
metadata.original_text: This solution is all you need to easily conduct and report on environmental noise surveys to ensure regulations compliance and investigate noise complaints.

Which solution should I use to measure n.text:
Measurement Procedure
Consider a noise source standing on a reflecting floor.

metadata.window:
This gives 
warnings regarding overloads and failed criteria, and a periodic 
sound signal assists you in keeping a steady scanning pace.
 During the measurement you can use the Surface View for 
housekeeping.  The coloured segments on top of the image of the 
measurement object are ideal for keeping track of the 
measurement process.
 Measurement Procedure
Consider a noise source standing on a reflecting floor.  Imagine a 
virtual box that completely envelops the source.  The sound power 
from the source will radiate through the five free segments of the 
box (right, left, front, rear, top).  Measure the average sound intensity 
for each of the five segments and the analyzer will calculate the 
resulting sound intensity and sound power for each segment and 
for the total box, taking the segment areas into account.
metadata.original_text:
Measurement Procedure
Consider a noise source standing on a reflecting floor.

Which solution should I use to measure n.text: They are often employed in environmental noise assessment from sound sources, such as industrial plants, road and rail traffic, and construction work.

metadata.window:
The electrical signal produced by the microphone is at a very low level and must be enhanced by a preamplifier, before reaching the main processor.
 Signal processing applies frequency weightings and time weightings to the signal, as specified by international standards such as IEC 61672 – 1, which a sound level meter complies with.
 MEASUREMENT APPLICATIONS
Sound level meters and analyzers are used to measure and manage noise from a variety of sources.  They are often employed in environmental noise assessment from sound sources, such as industrial plants, road and rail traffic, and construction work.
 In urban environments, noise pollution - or excessive noise exposure - directly affects the people who live and work in the affected areas.  To ensure noise regulations are followed, noise is measured from a variety of sources as sports events, outdoor concerts, parks, and residential- or commercial neighbours.  Each sound/noise source is defined by its own set of characteristics, which can pose challenges for the professionals assessing them.
metadata.original_text: They are often employed in environmental noise assessment from sound sources, such as industrial plants, road and rail traffic, and construction work.

Which solution should I use to conduct n.text:
Therefore, windscreens are gen-
erally used for outdoor measurements, but they can be used any time you want to protect measurements from
unwanted noise caused by air movement.

metadata.window:
✐Note: Generally, ISO requires free-field conditions and ANSI requires diffuse-field conditions.  Be sure to check your
local standards for the setting you require.
 Windscreens are used to reduce the amount of wind-induced noise in measurements.  Therefore, windscreens are gen-
erally used for outdoor measurements, but they can be used any time you want to protect measurements from
unwanted noise caused by air movement.
 Windscreen detect is the setting that enables or disables automatic detection of Windscreen UA-1650.
 l Enabled: The instrument detects the windscreen and applies the appropriate correction.
 l Disabled: Specify the windscreen manually under Windscreen type.
metadata.original_text:
Therefore, windscreens are gen-
erally used for outdoor measurements, but they can be used any time you want to protect measurements from
unwanted noise caused by air movement.

I need a solution for covering Frequency.text:
See Frequency range and
measurement time for more information about averaging times and Fixed or scanned measurements for information
For reverberation time measurements (T2), you should measure a minimum of 6 decays at a minimum of 3 fixed micro-
The low-frequency procedure of ISO 16283 requires fixed microphone positions in a minimum of four corners, with two
corners at ground level and two corners at ceiling level.

metadata.window:
For manually-scanned measurements, you should per-
form a minimum of one scan.  Ideally, the background noise in the receiving room (B2) should be measured con-
secutively with the sound level in the receiving room (L2) at the same measurement positions or traverse.
 ✐Note: It is important that the time spent measuring, for either a single manually-scanned measurement or multiple
measurements at fixed points, meets the averaging time requirements of the standard used.  See Frequency range and
measurement time for more information about averaging times and Fixed or scanned measurements for information
For reverberation time measurements (T2), you should measure a minimum of 6 decays at a minimum of 3 fixed micro-
The low-frequency procedure of ISO 16283 requires fixed microphone positions in a minimum of four corners, with two
corners at ground level and two corners at ceiling level.  Microphones may be mounted on a tripod or hand-held.
 For room background noise tests, you have the option to measure at one position only (the worst affected position) or
at multiple positions to determine the average noise levels in the room.
 See Room background noise for more information.
metadata.original_text:
See Frequency range and
measurement time for more information about averaging times and Fixed or scanned measurements for information
For reverberation time measurements (T2), you should measure a minimum of 6 decays at a minimum of 3 fixed micro-
The low-frequency procedure of ISO 16283 requires fixed microphone positions in a minimum of four corners, with two
corners at ground level and two corners at ceiling level.

measurements at fixed points, meets the averaging time requirements of the standard used.  See Frequency range and
measurement time for more information about averaging times and Fixed or scanned measurements for information
For reverberation time measurements (T2), you should measure a minimum of 6 decays at a minimum of 3 fixed micro-
The low-frequency procedure of ISO 16283 requires fixed microphone positions in a minimum of four corners, with two
corners at ground level and two corners at ceiling level.  Microphones may be mounted on a tripod or hand-held.
 For room background noise tests, you have the option to measure at one position only (the worst affected position) or
at multiple positions to determine the average noise levels in the room.
 See Room background noise for more information.
metadata.original_text:
See Frequency range and
measurement time for more information about averaging times and Fixed or scanned measurements for information
For reverberation time measurements (T2), you should measure a minimum of 6 decays at a minimum of 3 fixed micro-
The low-frequency procedure of ISO 16283 requires fixed microphone positions in a minimum of four corners, with two
corners at ground level and two corners at ceiling level.

I need to measure a residential building.text: The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.

metadata.window:
All speakers are connected in a series-parallel network to ensure both in-phase operation and an impedance that matches the power amplifier.
 The loudspeaker weighs less than 8 kg and is fitted with a convenient lifting handle that does not measurably interfere with the sound field.

 USE SCENARIOS
Room and building acoustics
Measuring airborne sound insulation
Measuring reverberation time
For most architectural acoustics measurements, the OmniPower sound source radiates sound evenly in all directions and gives reproducible and reliable results.  The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.
 Background noise is the enemy of good architectural acoustics measurements particularly at low frequencies where traffic noise and air conditioning systems are some of the main culprits i.e.  between 100 Hz and 200 Hz.
 The OmniPower sound source is designed to deliver its peak performance in this very same range delivering maximum power where it’s needed most.
metadata.original_text: The relevant architectural acoustics measurements standards (ISO 16283, ISO 10140 and ISO 3382) require the use of an omnidirectional sound source.

I need to perform sound power measuremen.text: Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.

metadata.window:
DIRAC is a valuable acoustics measurement tool for field and laboratory acoustics engineers, researchers and educational institutions.  Users can compare the acoustics of one room with another, validate sound systems and perform scale model measurements.Based on the measurement and analysis of impulse responses, the tool supports a variety of measurement configurations.

 DIRAC supports wireless room acoustics measurements when connected toHBK 2255 Sound Level Meteras a wireless microphone, and/orHBK 2755 Smart Power Amplifieras a wireless sound source.  Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.

 Speech intelligibility measurements can be carried out in compliance with the IEC 60268-16 standard, for male and female voices, through an artificial mouth-directional loudspeaker sound source or through direct injection into a sound system, taking into account the impact of background noise.

 In combination with Echo Speech Source Type 4720, speech intelligibility measurements can be performed quickly and easily.  The Echo delivers a calibrated signal that is used by DIRAC to calculate different speech intelligibility parameters.
metadata.original_text: Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.

Users can compare the acoustics of one room with another, validate sound systems and perform scale model measurements.

 DIRAC supports wireless room acoustics measurements when connected to
HBK 2255 Sound Level Meter
as a wireless microphone, and/or
HBK 2755 Smart Power Amplifier
as a wireless sound source.  Multi-channel measurements can be made using multiple HBK 2255’s, or with most Windows compatible multi-channel sound devices.
 Speech intelligibility measurements can be carried out in compliance with the IEC 60268-16 standard, for male and female voices, through an artificial mouth-directional loudspeaker sound source or through direct injection into a sound system, taking into account the impact of background noise.
 In combination with Echo Speech Source Type 4720, speech intelligibility measurements can be performed quickly and easily.  The Echo delivers a calibrated signal that is used by DIRAC to calculate different speech intelligibility parameters.

I need a solution that covers standard c.text:
USER SCENARIOS
Measuring and reporting of sound power levels in accordance with ISO 3744 and ISO 3746 standards to demonstrate product compliance with noise specifications for legislation or commendation
Assessing noise emissions from toys according to EN 71-1
Determining noise emissions of machinery and equipment for ensuring compliance with standards or benchmarking for comparisons
Determining sound pressure levels at workstations
R&D and quality assurance testing products for analysis to identify and evaluate prominent discrete tones and impulsive noise
ADDITIONAL CAPABILITIES
Additional licenses can be installed on HBK 2255.

metadata.window:
PC APP
The Product Noise Partner PC application supports you through every step of the measurement process, from choosing a standard, through defining the device geometry and measurement positions, to calculating the final result.  The PC app can even be used to wirelessly control measurements with your HBK 2255.  Product Noise Partner PC software is preconfigured with the tools needed for storing, reviewing and reporting your data.

 USER SCENARIOS
Measuring and reporting of sound power levels in accordance with ISO 3744 and ISO 3746 standards to demonstrate product compliance with noise specifications for legislation or commendation
Assessing noise emissions from toys according to EN 71-1
Determining noise emissions of machinery and equipment for ensuring compliance with standards or benchmarking for comparisons
Determining sound pressure levels at workstations
R&D and quality assurance testing products for analysis to identify and evaluate prominent discrete tones and impulsive noise
ADDITIONAL CAPABILITIES
Additional licenses can be installed on HBK 2255.  Ensure that you have the right tools for your job to do:
Enviro Noise Partner – evaluate environmental noise to ensure compliance with standards.  The focused toolset ensures that you have all the tools needed for the job, including markers to isolate sounds (exclude superfluous noise or mark pertinent noise for further examination) and checklists to ensure the job is done correctly
Work Noise Partner – evaluate workplace noise to ensure compliance with regulations and safeguard employee safety, including determining the need and level for hearing protection.  The interface guides you through a full survey and requires minimal training to ensure valid and actionable data

I would like to have a solution for nois.text: Measurement audio can be streamed to your phone while measuring, useful in situations where you cannot be physically close to the sound level meter, or to listen for wind-induced noise.

metadata.window:
Once the Enviro Noise Partner app is downloaded to your phone from the App Store®, your B&K 2245 sound level meter can be wirelessly controlled from your phone – you can even control multiple sound level meters simultaneously.  All measurement capabilities are available from the app, with intuitive measurement profile screens that enable you to pinch the graph to zoom or swipe it to move back and forth through time.  This makes it very easy to mark events and isolate sounds so that you can, for example, exclude a barking dog from a measurement.  Measurement audio can be streamed to your phone while measuring, useful in situations where you cannot be physically close to the sound level meter, or to listen for wind-induced noise.  Via the app interface, pictures, text and voice notes, and videos can be embedded with the measurements to document your work.

 With the accompanying PC app, all data can be transferred to a PC, wirelessly or with the supplied USB cable.  Just like the mobile app, the Enviro Noise Partner PC app is an excellent tool for adding markers for events and isolating sounds for further investigation or exclusion.
metadata.original_text: Measurement audio can be streamed to your phone while measuring, useful in situations where you cannot be physically close to the sound level meter, or to listen for wind-induced noise.

All measurement capabilities are available from the app, with intuitive measurement profile screens that enable you to pinch the graph to zoom or swipe it to move back and forth through time.  This makes it very easy to mark events and isolate sounds so that you can, for example, exclude a barking dog from a measurement.  Measurement audio can be streamed to your phone while measuring, useful in situations where you cannot be physically close to the sound level meter, or to listen for wind-induced noise.  Via the app interface, pictures, text and voice notes, and videos can be embedded with the measurements to document your work.
 PC App
With the accompanying PC app, all data can be transferred to a PC, wirelessly or with the supplied USB cable.  Just like the mobile app, the Enviro Noise Partner PC app is an excellent tool for adding markers for events and isolating sounds for further investigation or exclusion.

Which solutions gives basic logging and.text:
Fast logging is very similar to regular logging, the difference is that data is logged at
shorter intervals.

metadata.window:
This setting controls the number of seconds that will be erased when the measurement is resumed.  This setting is
enabled when Back-erase mode is set to Enabled.
 HBK 2255 can fast log broadband parameters with one frequency weighting and spectrum parameters with up to two
simultaneous frequency weightings.  Fast logging is very similar to regular logging, the difference is that data is logged at
shorter intervals.  Fast logging requires the BZ-7301 or BZ-7450 licence to be installed and enabled on your instrument.
 How to set up fast logging measurements
1.  Go to Measurement settings > Measurement control.
metadata.original_text:
Fast logging is very similar to regular logging, the difference is that data is logged at
shorter intervals.

Which solutions gives basic logging and.text:
Fast logging is very similar to regular logging, the difference is that data is logged at
shorter intervals.

metadata.window:
✐Note: F time weighting can be used for most measurements.
 l S = 1 s time constant, decay of 4.3 dB/s
The relatively slow rise and decay of this time weighting means it will smooth the variations in the vibration sig-
When choosing a time weighting to use, ask yourself if you want to track or smooth the variations in vibration levels
The Fast logging setting allows you to enable and disable parameters for fast logging.
 HBK 2255 can fast log broadband parameters with one frequency weighting and spectrum parameters with up to two
simultaneous frequency weightings.  Fast logging is very similar to regular logging, the difference is that data is logged at
shorter intervals.  Fast logging requires the BZ-7301 or BZ-7450 licence to be installed and enabled on your instrument.
 Menu location: Measurement settings > Fast logging
How to set up fast logging measurements
1.  Go to Measurement settings > Measurement control.

shorter intervals.
